titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Rockefeller University Concerts
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Rockefeller University Concerts FA879

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-11-02 01:19:18 -0400.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Rockefeller University Concerts

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In the fall of 1959 The Rockefeller University (formerly The Rockefeller Institute) under the inspiration and direction of Dr. Theodore Shedlovsky instituted a series of subscription concerts on Wednesday evenings and occasionally on Sunday afternoons. These became an established University event, well attended by faculty and students and frequently preceded by a buffet dinner in the Abby Aldrich Hall dining room. On Dr. Shedlovsky's death, along with his papers, the tapes of the concerts were given to the University archives.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Correspondence dealing with concert plans and arrangements are contained in the Theodore Shedlovsky papers.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 25 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Chronological. Years are divided by the academic year (September-May)

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Contents of the collection are primarily audio tapes and reels.

Almost all the concerts were taped on 7 inch reels. In some instances duplicate tapes have already been made. Originals and duplicates are boxed together chronologically. In most instances there is a copy of the concert program in the tape box. Another set of programs is shelved with the tape collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: concert programs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tapes lacking for following concerts [See photocopy of attached letter dated August 3, 1977. Stephen Szabo / Ilse Naumann.]
Pasternak / Newbold - piano and clarinet (program in Box no (10) 1) January 5, 1977
NY Chamber Soloists (program in Box no (10) 1) January 19, 1977
Jacob Lateiner - pianist (program in Box no. (10) 1) March 16, 1977.
